item.title: Gap?!
item.dc:creator: @vtw vtw
item.description:
@vtw wrote:

When i set the layout to null and now the panel doesnt even appear. also tried setting the bounds and it didnt move. Im trying to work out if its a result of putting an Applet into a JPanel.

P.S. Im almost certain the problems to do with my Loader class, heres the whole code. The stuff i have commented out was because i was testing to see if it fixed the problem.

	private final void loadClient() throws InstantiationException,
			IllegalAccessException, ClassNotFoundException, IOException {

		//setBounds(0, 29, 762, 501);
		//setPreferredSize(new Dimension(763, 501));
		//setBackground(new Color(0, 0, 0));
	
		MyClassLoader classLoader = new MyClassLoader(new JarFile("loader-640.jar"));
		client = (Applet) classLoader.loadClass("loader").newInstance();
		client.setStub(this);
		client.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(763, 501));
		client.init();
		client.start();
		add(client);
	}

Read full topic

I’m not honestly sure, but you could try setting the bounds explicitly to begin at 0,0?

variable.setBounds(0,0,w,h); // Force it to start at position 0,0

item.title: Gap?!
item.dc:creator: @vtw vtw
item.description:
@vtw wrote:

Changing dimensions didnt make a difference, as it had nothing to do wit the dimensions. I’m leading towards the idea tha tit has something to do with the nested applet inside of a panel thats holding the canvas.

public class Bot extends JFrame {

        public Bot() {

                setPreferredSize(new Dimension(765, 503));
                {
                        add(new Loader("world54"));
                }
                pack();
                setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
                setResizable(false);
                setVisible(true);
        }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Gap?!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

From MoparScape 317 and 508 client versions:

public java.awt.Dimension getDimension() { return new java.awt.Dimension(765, 503); }

I’m fairly confident it’s the same now, but you can tell by looking at the source code of the non-javascript client.

item.title: Gap?!
item.dc:creator: @vtw vtw
item.description:
@vtw wrote:

Haha been messing around with this all day, just wanted to make sure all the components are nested properly but this annoying gap wont go away. No idea why its there but if anyone has any solutions that would be much appreciated.

2v9ol10.png774×537 

public class Bot extends JFrame {

	public Bot() {

		setPreferredSize(new Dimension(764, 556));
		{
			add(new Loader("world54"));
		}
		pack();
		setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		setResizable(false);
		setVisible(true);
	}
}

Been really struggling with building a GUI with java
